vote.title: To authorize the Director of the Department of Technology, on behalf of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion, to modify and extend an existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024 through December 31, 2023, and to authorize the use of any remaining funds/unspent balance existing on purchase order PO303024.  ($0.00)
vote.description:
Explanation
This ordinance authorizes the Director of Technology to modify and extend an existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc., Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024. No new or additional funds are associated with this extension. Rather, the extension makes the remaining funds on the above-referenced purchase order available for an additional year, to December 31, 2023.
 
On November 22, 2021, Ordinance 3023-2021 authorized the Director of the Department of Technology (DoT), on behalf of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion (ODI), to enter into contract with OnActuate Consulting, Inc.to finalize Phases I and II of the B2GNow Certification Management project. Since the original contract, associated with the above-mentioned ordinance, will expire on December 31 of this year, DoT would like to extend it for one full year, through December 31, 2023, via the extension of purchase order PO303024.
 
As explained in ordinance 3023-2021, the B2Gnow application will replace the city’s limited-function BiZTrak system and will include a compliance module and the ability to access utilization reports. This new system will allow ODI to better manage and access the City’s compliance data.
 
FISCAL IMPACT
No additional costs are associated with this ordinance. Passage of this ordinance makes the remaining funds on the above-referenced purchase order available for an additional year, to December 31, 2023.
 
CONTRACT COMPLIANCE
OnActuate Consulting, Inc. Inc.
C.C. #/F.I.D #: 98-1369812                      Expiration Date: 6/28/2023
DAX Vendor Account #: 027985
 
 
Title
To authorize the Director of the Department of Technology, on behalf of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion, to modify and extend an existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024 through December 31, 2023, and to authorize the use of any remaining funds/unspent balance existing on purchase order PO303024.  ($0.00)
 
Body
WHEREAS, On November 22, 2021, Ordinance 3023-2021 passed, authorizing the Director of the Department of Technology, on behalf of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion, to enter into contract with OnActuate Consulting, Inc., to finalize Phases I and II of the B2GNow Certification Management project; and
 
WHEREAS, to ensure the completion of the above-mentioned project, there is a need to modify and extend the existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc., Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024 through December 31, 2023; and
 
WHEREAS, it is necessary to modify and extend an existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc., Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024 through December 31, 2023 to finalize Phases I and II of ODI’s B2GNow Certification Management project for the preservation of the public health, peace, property and safety and welfare, now therefore:
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1. That the Director of the Department of Technology be and is hereby authorized to modify and extend an existing agreement with OnActuate Consulting, Inc., Inc. through extension of purchase order PO303024.
 
SECTION 2. That the extension of purchase order PO303024 through December 31, 2023 is hereby authorized.
 
SECTION 3. That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes to revise the funding source for all contracts or all contract modifications associated with this ordinance.
 
SECTION 4. That the funds necessary to carry out the purpose of this ordinance are hereby deemed appropriated and the City Auditor shall establish such accounting codes as necessary.
 
SECTION 5. That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
